channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Collective Human Opinions in Semantic Textual Similarity
item.description: Despite the subjective nature of semantic textual similarity (STS) and pervasive disagreements in STS annotation, existing benchmarks have used averaged human ratings as the gold standard.

item.title: PUG: Photorealistic and Semantically Controllable Synthetic Data for Representation Learning
item.description: Synthetic image datasets offer unmatched advantages for designing and evaluating deep neural networks: they make it possible to (i) render as many data samples as needed, (ii) precisely control each scene and yield granular ground truth labels (and captions), (iii) precisely control distribution shifts between training and testing to isolate variables of interest for sound experimentation.

item.title: In-Context Alignment: Chat with Vanilla Language Models Before Fine-Tuning
item.description: In this note, we explore inference-time alignment through in-context learning.

item.title: Studying Socially Unacceptable Discourse Classification (SUD) through different eyes: "Are we on the same page ?"
item.description: We study Socially Unacceptable Discourse (SUD) characterization and detection in online text.

item.title: PAIF: Perception-Aware Infrared-Visible Image Fusion for Attack-Tolerant Semantic Segmentation
item.description: We first conduct systematic analyses about the components of image fusion, investigating the correlation with segmentation robustness under adversarial perturbations.

item.title: Synthetic Augmentation with Large-scale Unconditional Pre-training
item.description: To further reduce the dependency on annotated data, we propose a synthetic augmentation method called HistoDiffusion, which can be pre-trained on large-scale unlabeled datasets and later applied to a small-scale labeled dataset for augmented training.

item.title: EPCFormer: Expression Prompt Collaboration Transformer for Universal Referring Video Object Segmentation
item.description: Next, we propose an Expression Alignment (EA) mechanism for audio and text expressions.

item.title: Towards an AI to Win Ghana's National Science and Maths Quiz
item.description: Can an AI win Ghana's National Science and Maths Quiz (NSMQ)?

item.title: On Monotonic Aggregation for Open-domain QA
item.description: Our experiments show that our framework not only ensures monotonicity, but also outperforms state-of-the-art multi-source QA methods on Natural Questions.

item.title: SSTFormer: Bridging Spiking Neural Network and Memory Support Transformer for Frame-Event based Recognition
item.description: Secondly, they adopt either Spiking Neural Networks (SNN) for energy-efficient recognition with suboptimal results, or Artificial Neural Networks (ANN) for energy-intensive, high-performance recognition.

item.title: Lossy and Lossless (L$^2$) Post-training Model Size Compression
item.description: Then, a dedicated differentiable counter is introduced to guide the optimization of lossy compression to arrive at a more suitable point for later lossless compression.

item.title: SILO Language Models: Isolating Legal Risk In a Nonparametric Datastore
item.description: SILO is built by (1) training a parametric LM on Open License Corpus (OLC), a new corpus we curate with 228B tokens of public domain and permissively licensed text and (2) augmenting it with a more general and easily modifiable nonparametric datastore (e. g., containing copyrighted books or news) that is only queried during inference.

item.title: Online Distillation-enhanced Multi-modal Transformer for Sequential Recommendation
item.description: To be specific, we first introduce an ID-aware Multi-modal Transformer module in the item representation learning stage to facilitate information interaction among different features.

item.title: Varying-coefficients for regional quantile via KNN-based LASSO with applications to health outcome study
item.description: Health outcomes, such as body mass index and cholesterol levels, are known to be dependent on age and exhibit varying effects with their associated risk factors.

item.title: InfeRE: Step-by-Step Regex Generation via Chain of Inference
item.description: Particularly, InfeRE outperforms the popular tree-based generation approach by 18. 1% and 11. 3% on both datasets, respectively, in terms of DFA@5 accuracy.

item.title: Class-level Structural Relation Modelling and Smoothing for Visual Representation Learning
item.description: Representation learning for images has been advanced by recent progress in more complex neural models such as the Vision Transformers and new learning theories such as the structural causal models.

item.title: Coarse-to-Fine: Learning Compact Discriminative Representation for Single-Stage Image Retrieval
item.description: Image retrieval targets to find images from a database that are visually similar to the query image.

item.title: Unifying Two-Stream Encoders with Transformers for Cross-Modal Retrieval
item.description: Specifically, on two key tasks, \textit{i. e.}, image-to-text and text-to-image retrieval, HAT achieves 7. 6\% and 16. 7\% relative score improvement of Recall@1 on MSCOCO, and 4. 4\% and 11. 6\% on Flickr30k respectively.

item.title: SDLFormer: A Sparse and Dense Locality-enhanced Transformer for Accelerated MR Image Reconstruction
item.description: The self-attention mechanism of the transformer enables transformers to capture long-range dependencies in the images, which might be desirable for accelerated MRI image reconstruction as the effect of undersampling is non-local in the image domain.

item.title: How Generalizable are Deepfake Detectors? An Empirical Study
item.description: Deepfake videos and images are becoming increasingly credible, posing a significant threat given their potential to facilitate fraud or bypass access control systems.

item.title: Advancing Natural-Language Based Audio Retrieval with PaSST and Large Audio-Caption Data Sets
item.description: This work presents a text-to-audio-retrieval system based on pre-trained text and spectrogram transformers.

item.title: XGBD: Explanation-Guided Graph Backdoor Detection
item.description: An emerging detection strategy in the vision and NLP domains is based on an intriguing phenomenon: when training models on a mixture of backdoor and clean samples, the loss on backdoor samples drops significantly faster than on clean samples, allowing backdoor samples to be easily detected by selecting samples with the lowest loss values.

item.title: Your Negative May not Be True Negative: Boosting Image-Text Matching with False Negative Elimination
item.description: Most existing image-text matching methods adopt triplet loss as the optimization objective, and choosing a proper negative sample for the triplet of <anchor, positive, negative> is important for effectively training the model, e. g., hard negatives make the model learn efficiently and effectively.

item.title: V-DETR: DETR with Vertex Relative Position Encoding for 3D Object Detection
item.description: We introduce a highly performant 3D object detector for point clouds using the DETR framework.

item.title: SimplyRetrieve: A Private and Lightweight Retrieval-Centric Generative AI Tool
item.description: Large Language Model (LLM) based Generative AI systems have seen significant progress in recent years.

item.title: Towards Top-Down Stereoscopic Image Quality Assessment via Stereo Attention
item.description: This paper presents a novel network for SIQA via stereo attention, employing a top-down perspective to guide the quality assessment process.

item.title: Under-Display Camera Image Restoration with Scattering Effect
item.description: With the physical model of the scattering effect, we improve the image formation pipeline for the image synthesis to construct a realistic UDC dataset with ground truths.

item.title: MindDiffuser: Controlled Image Reconstruction from Human Brain Activity with Semantic and Structural Diffusion
item.description: In Stage 2, we utilize the CLIP visual feature decoded from fMRI as supervisory information, and continually adjust the two feature vectors decoded in Stage 1 through backpropagation to align the structural information.

item.title: AICSD: Adaptive Inter-Class Similarity Distillation for Semantic Segmentation
item.description: With inference time being a crucial factor, particularly in dense prediction tasks such as semantic segmentation, knowledge distillation has emerged as a successful technique for improving the accuracy of lightweight student networks.

item.title: ConDistFL: Conditional Distillation for Federated Learning from Partially Annotated Data
item.description: Federated learning (FL) is a key technology enabling the collaborative development of a model without exchanging training data.

item.title: Extracting detailed oncologic history and treatment plan from medical oncology notes with large language models
item.description: Both medical care and observational studies in oncology require a thorough understanding of a patient's disease progression and treatment history, often elaborately documented in clinical notes.

item.title: PaniniQA: Enhancing Patient Education Through Interactive Question Answering
item.description: Patient portal allows discharged patients to access their personalized discharge instructions in electronic health records (EHRs).

item.title: Do You Remember? Overcoming Catastrophic Forgetting for Fake Audio Detection
item.description: The orthogonal weight modification to overcome catastrophic forgetting does not consider the similarity of genuine audio across different datasets.

item.title: Generalized Early Stopping in Evolutionary Direct Policy Search
item.description: In such cases, it makes sense to stop the evaluation early to save computation time.

item.title: HomOpt: A Homotopy-Based Hyperparameter Optimization Method
item.description: Traditional methods, like grid search and Bayesian optimization, often struggle to quickly adapt and efficiently search the loss landscape.

item.title: AgentBench: Evaluating LLMs as Agents
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) are becoming increasingly smart and autonomous, targeting real-world pragmatic missions beyond traditional NLP tasks.

item.title: SynJax: Structured Probability Distributions for JAX
item.description: The models that explicitly account for structured objects, such as trees and segmentations, did not benefit equally because they require custom algorithms that are difficult to implement in a vectorized form.

item.title: PURL: Safe and Effective Sanitization of Link Decoration
item.description: Since trackers need to exfiltrate information from the client- to server-side through link decoration regardless of the tracking technique they employ, a promising orthogonal approach is to detect and sanitize tracking information in decorated links.

item.title: Lighting Every Darkness in Two Pairs: A Calibration-Free Pipeline for RAW Denoising
item.description: Calibration-based methods have dominated RAW image denoising under extremely low-light environments.

item.title: Dual Aggregation Transformer for Image Super-Resolution
item.description: Based on the above idea, we propose a novel Transformer model, Dual Aggregation Transformer (DAT), for image SR. Our DAT aggregates features across spatial and channel dimensions, in the inter-block and intra-block dual manner.

item.title: APBench: A Unified Benchmark for Availability Poisoning Attacks and Defenses
item.description: To further evaluate the attack and defense capabilities of these poisoning methods, we have developed a benchmark -- APBench for assessing the efficacy of adversarial poisoning.

item.title: Multi-View Graph Convolutional Network for Multimedia Recommendation
item.description: Meanwhile, a behavior-aware fuser is designed to comprehensively model user preferences by adaptively learning the relative importance of different modality features.

item.title: Analysis of the Evolution of Advanced Transformer-Based Language Models: Experiments on Opinion Mining
item.description: Opinion mining, also known as sentiment analysis, is a subfield of natural language processing (NLP) that focuses on identifying and extracting subjective information in textual material.

item.title: DiffSynth: Latent In-Iteration Deflickering for Realistic Video Synthesis
item.description: In recent years, diffusion models have emerged as the most powerful approach in image synthesis.

item.title: Emotionally Numb or Empathetic? Evaluating How LLMs Feel Using EmotionBench
item.description: We aspire to contribute to the advancement of LLMs regarding better alignment with the emotional behaviors of human beings, thereby enhancing their utility and applicability as intelligent assistants.

item.title: Distributionally Robust Classification on a Data Budget
item.description: To our knowledge, this is the first result showing (near) state-of-the-art distributional robustness on limited data budgets.

item.title: Generative Benchmark Creation for Table Union Search
item.description: We thoroughly evaluate recent existing table union search methods over existing benchmarks and our new benchmark.

item.title: SciGraphQA: A Large-Scale Synthetic Multi-Turn Question-Answering Dataset for Scientific Graphs
item.description: We asked GPT-4 to assess the matching quality of our question-answer turns given the paper's context, obtaining an average rating of 8. 7/10 on our 3K test set.

item.title: Variable importance for causal forests: breaking down the heterogeneity of treatment effects
item.description: In this article, we develop a new importance variable algorithm for causal forests, to quantify the impact of each input on the heterogeneity of treatment effects.

item.title: Unsupervised Adversarial Detection without Extra Model: Training Loss Should Change
item.description: Adversarial robustness poses a critical challenge in the deployment of deep learning models for real-world applications.
